document.full_text: u.s. medicare regulators on thursday launched a program for doctors to deliver more follow-up care to patients that they predict will save the government as much as $960 million over the next three years while providing better healthcare for the elderly.
document.title: u.s. medicare rules seek improved care, lower costs
lines_and_colors: u.s. medicare regulators on thursday launched a program for doctors to deliver more follow-up care to patients that they predict will save the government as much as $960 million over the next three years while providing better healthcare for the elderly.
